intro: Pseudojumellea mauritiana, commonly known as the Mauritius starfish plant, is a unique succulent native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many flowering plants adapted to arid environments. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, spiny stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
